data.name: Spaceteam VR
data.description:
A chaotic co-op party shouting game. Things might get heated but always work together as a Spaceteam!

The ship's computer is out of control, your only chance of surviving longer than one sector is to shout technobabble at your friends!

Try to follow the randomly generated, incorrectly assigned, sometimes impossible to pronounce instructions and steer your ship out of the path of a supernova.

Complete enough instructions successfully and you will progress to the next sector, each more difficult and so the ship becomes harder to control. Dodge asteroids by shaking your maracas, clean up alien goop and disco dance like your life depends on it!

Ways to play:

VR MULTIPLAYER

Up to 6 players, in any popular VR headset join in a co-op game trying to avoid their inevitable doom.

FACE TO FACE

Up to 6 players with at least 1 headset and connected smart devices, this feels much like the original Spaceteam game.

SINGLE PLAYER

In Practice Mode your Spaceteam will be 2 of our trusty robots!

changelog.change_log:
Build 5005-r7421
· Fixed an issue preventing additional VR players from joining Face to Face games

Build 4900 (2nd March 2022) - revision 7358

- Fixed a bug where occasionally games were not found

If you experience any issues please get in touch at https://www.coopinnovations.co.uk/spaceteamvrsupport/

Build 4892 (1st March 2022) - revision 7353

- Fixed a bug where in the games browser, games could incorrectly show as having 0 players

If you experience any issues please get in touch at https://www.coopinnovations.co.uk/spaceteamvrsupport/

Build notes 4878 (28th February 2022) - revision 7345

- Server backend has changed

If you experience any issues please get in touch at https://www.coopinnovations.co.uk/spaceteamvrsupport/

Give the gift of Spaceteam this Valentine's Day!

Check out the instructions on our social media this weekend for a free copy for a friend or loved one!

Build Notes – 4763 (16th December 2021) – revision 7245

- Fixed a bug where Face to Face players were shown a network error when trying to connect to a game
- Build size is now smaller
- Improved loading times
- Updated engine version

Build Notes – 4738 (28th October 2021) –  revision 7227

New Features
•	The ship has been invaded by pumpkins!
•	Halloween Party accessories are now available once more!

Build Notes – 4706 (8th September 2021) –  revision 7203

New Features
•	Looking For Group has now been added. This new feature will notify you when there are public games running if you are not in an online game yourself. This is enabled for all users by default in the main menu and can turned on/off via a button on the console in the main menu
•	The console has been revamped – we’ve reorganised the console and added some quality-of-life improvements to make it easier to find the game modes that you’re looking for
•	New ranks have been added to player tags

Bug Fixes
•	Fixed a bug where it was not possible to move sliders without grabbing them
•	Fixed a bug where debris didn't launch in the intended direction
•	Fixed a bug where anomalies would instantly fail if replayed without starting a fresh game
•	Fixed a bug where it was possible to interact with the pause menu when the report menu was open
•	Fixed a bug where it was possible to get someone else’s haptics in your controller

Build Notes – 4701 (26th August 2021) –  revision 7198
August Event - The Coming of The Martians

Event Features
•	New “Martian Green” outfit can be unlocked by shooting 15 UFOs during the event
•	Unlock progress is displayed at round end
•	The UFO spawn rate has been increased
•	The UFO difficulty (aim accuracy and speed) has been decreased
•	Your event progress is can also been seen as a new entry in the leaderboards

New Features
•	The console has been revamped – we’ve reorganised the console and added some quality-of-life improvements to make it easier to find the game modes that you’re looking for
•	Quickplay will now offer the option to play practice mode if there are no online games available
•	Looking For Group has now been added. This new feature will notify you when there are public games running if you are not in an online game yourself. This is enabled for all users by default and can turned on/off via a button on the console in the main menu
•	New ranks have been added to player tags
•	Rank progression is now shown through a new notification that can be seen at round end

Bug Fixes
•	Fixed a bug where it was not possible to move sliders without grabbing them
•	Fixed a bug where debris didn't launch in the intended direction
•	Fixed a bug where anomalies would instantly fail if replayed without starting a fresh game
•	Fixed a bug where it was possible to interact with the pause menu when the report menu was open
•	Fixed a bug where it was possible to get someone else’s haptics in your controller
Uploaded from Jenkins - 4258

Build Notes - Hotfix 4244-r6843 (24th May)

General
Improved robot navigation

Bugs
Fixed a bug where players could potentially not be signed into online services, which could affect player's access to online dependant functionality

Build Notes – 4227 (21st May 2021) – revision 6825

Hotfix patch

Bugs fixes
* Fixed a bug where the incorrect user tag was showing for some users

Build Notes – 4214 (21st May 2021) – revision 6810
Spaceteam’s 1st Birthday Update!

New Features
•	New alien fish head has been added and is available to all players
•	New cosmetic items can be unlocked by completing challenges during this birthday event
    o	    X-Ray glasses are unlocked for logging in
    o	    A new pink outfit is unlocked for participating in a multiplayer game
    o	    A new orange outfit is unlocked after completing 5 sectors in multiplayer
•	Support for LIV has been added – get started at https://www.liv.tv/

Bug Fixes
•	Fixed a bug where it was not possible to move sliders without grabbing them

Build Notes – 4214 (21st May 2021) – revision 6810
Spaceteam’s 1st Birthday Update!

New Features
•	New alien fish head has been added and is available to all players
•	New cosmetic items can be unlocked by completing challenges during this birthday event
    o	    X-Ray glasses are unlocked for logging in
    o	    A new pink outfit is unlocked for participating in a multiplayer game
    o	    A new orange outfit is unlocked after completing 5 sectors in multiplayer
•	Support for LIV has been added – get started at https://www.liv.tv/

Bug Fixes
•	Fixed a bug where it was not possible to move sliders without grabbing them

Lifetime Achievement Awards! – #3875 

Cosmic greetings! In this update we have several quality-of-life improvements and bug fixes to make your intergalactic journey more enjoyable. 

Some of our in-game achievements had been sucked into a black hole. Through a scientific process that’s too complex to type out on a human keyboard, we’ve managed to recover them.

When you first log into Spaceteam VR after this update, any achievements owed to you will be unlocked – the spam is one time only! 
 
General 
•	General improvements to VOIP stability and quality 
•	It is now possible to report other players 
•	Prefixes to usernames can now be enabled to indicate a player’s platform 
•	The console will now be hidden when spawning the pause menu 
  
Bug fixes 
•	Fixed an issue where earned achievements would not be unlocked (prepare for some achievement spam after logging in) 
•	Fixed issue where a player leaving could cause a crash when the game started 
•	Fixed a bug where some Vive users’ refresh rate wasn't detected as 90hz 
•	Fixed an issue where objects remained grabbed when pausing 
 
Thanks for playing and please leave a review if you're enjoying the game and if not please get in touch with us! 
 
Also please remember to join us on Thursdays and Saturdays for our regular events!

Build 3742

Hotfix patch for server connection issue

New Years (bug) Resolutions!

Oculus Quest
* Added an option for selecting refresh rate on Quest 2

General
* Keep an eye out for ‘News Available’ notifications about our upcoming updates!

Bug Fixes
* Fixed a bug that caused joining via code to place players in the wrong game
* Fixed a bug that would allow players to join a game after it had started
* Fixed a bug where the user could be pushed back by the in-game menu
* Fixed a bug that caused the “public game” notification to appear for private games

General
VOIP quality improvements, fixes for some cut outs and non-working voice that could occur!
Improved Quest performance
Smoothed out the movement of our UFOs
Added player has joined notifications
Sometimes incorrect player names fixed up 
Removed the pumpkins!

Networking
Game lobbies show whether open or in progress
Fixed incorrect region selection 
Improved networking of thrown objects, fixes up debris issues 

Quest 
Fixed up colour space on Quest 1 + 2
Increased FX visual quality on Quest 2

Controls
Fixed sponge collisions with some controls
Fixes to the pump thresholds and added notifications to it, pumping should now be 42% more fun!

Symbol mode
Improved the readability of multi-glyph controls
Fixed up incidental instructions breaking symbols appearing for all the panel

Robots
You can now play as one of our three robots! (CRT-3000, Cylindrake and Priscilla)
Should now be friendlier and wave at you properly!
Gave them a few tweaks and upgraded their OS

Difficulty
Tweaked hard mode to make it a little smoother difficulty wise

Welcome to our spooky seasonal update!

We figure there are not going to be that many Halloween Parties in the physical world this year so why not make the most of it in the virtual world!?

You can expect some fabulous, if freakish, new accessories, pumpkins and possibly more slime than usual!

Included in this update is... 

Halloween party!
* Halloween Party accessories to dress up in
* The ship has been invaded by Pumpkins!
* Our Robots are also getting into the spirit of Halloween!

New game mode!
* We’ve added a symbols only difficulty mode, it works a little different to the mobile version of symbols but we’re looking forward to hearing your feedback as we evolve this and other game modes!

Known issues
* We’ve encountered an issue on Quest with the microphone capture sometimes not working on first play in a session – we are actively working on a fix for this, please let us know if you encounter it! (NOTE - we've since applied a hot fix to Quest, please let us know if you still encounter this)

Join us for our spooky Thursday Team Time tonight!
